full_summary:
### Fabrication and Installation of a Radio Frequency Testing Mobile Anechoic Chamber

#### Bid Announcement and Call for Submissions

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) is seeking proposals from qualified suppliers for the fabrication and installation of a radio frequency (RF) testing mobile anechoic chamber. The chamber will be used for radio frequency propagation to an existing external trailer unit.

**Bid Requirements**

The successful supplier must deliver the following:

* Fabricate and install 1 Anechoic Chamber for RF propagation
* Meet all security requirements outlined in the bid documents
* Provide deliverables on or before 31 March 2023

**Bid Selection Criteria**

The bid will be selected based on the Lowest Compliant Bid. Suppliers are encouraged to review the attached bid documents for detailed information on the bid requirements and selection criteria.

**Important Notice**

The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in RCMP contracting activities as outlined in this solicitation.

**Bid Documents and Instructions**

The bid documents, including the Request for Proposal (RFP) and amendments, can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders. Suppliers are responsible for regularly consulting GETS for the most up-to-date information.

**Contact Information**

For further information, please contact:

Megan McCoy
Senior Procurement Officer
Royal Canadian Mounted Police
Procurement and Contracting Services
73 Leikin Drive, Ottawa, Ontario K1A 0R2
Telephone: 343-549-1789
Email: Megan.McCoy@rcmp-grc.gc.ca

**Bid Submission Guidelines**

Bids must be submitted in either English or French and must include all required documentation. The RCMP retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.

**Notice of Procurement**

The RCMP will make available notices of proposed procurement (NPP) and bid solicitations through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders. Suppliers are responsible for regularly consulting GETS for the most up-to-date information.

**Note**

The RCMP is not liable for any oversight on the part of the bidder or for notification services offered by a third party. Suppliers are responsible for ensuring that they have obtained the most up-to-date information on the procurement.
